questions.question_text: What should a Development Team do if it realizes it has selected too much work after starting the Sprint?

discussion.content: No the B answer is mentionning the product backlog, not the sprint backlog. So in that case only D is acceptable in Scrum point of view

choices.D: Continue working and update the Product Owner at the Sprint Review.
choices.C: Add additional team members to handle the extra work.
choices.B: Work with the Product Owner to remove some work or Product Backlog items as soon as possible.
choices.A: Modify the definition of ג€Doneג€ to ensure all Product Backlog items can be done by the end of the Sprint.

questions.answer_description: The Sprint Backlog is a living artifact that evolves and changes as more is learned or discovered.

choices.B: Assign them to the technical leads on the team.
choices.C: They will be addressed in the Integration Sprints.
choices.A: Ensure they are addressed in every Increment.
choices.D: Add them to a separate non-functional requirements list.

questions.answer_description: Non-functional requirements should be worked on alongside functional development.
questions.question_text: What should a Development Team do with non-functional requirements?

choices.C: Writing User Stories and reordering the Product Backlog.
choices.B: Select the Product Backlog items for the Sprint and do the work planned in the Sprint Backlog.
choices.A: Update stakeholders on the daily progress and keep the burn-down chart updated.
choices.D: Deciding on the value of the product features and value estimations.

questions.question_text: What would be the responsibilities of a self-organizing Development Team?

Scrum promotes self-organization.
Which of these statements would NOT support self-organizing?

choices.D: Removing titles for Development Team members.
choices.A: The Development Team deciding what work to do in a Sprint.

questions.answer_description: The ones doing the work are the best ones to decide what they can do and how to do it.

choices.C: Each Scrum Team would select an equal number of items.
choices.E: The Scrum Team with the highest productivity will select the items first.
choices.A: The Product Owner will present the work and the Development Teams will select the items they will work on.
choices.D: The Product Owner assigns the work to each team.
choices.B: The Product Owner creates separate Product Backlogs for each Development Team.
